# Data exploration

I got 10 TMS4 sensors ([website](https://tomst.com/web/en/systems/tms/tms-4/)) from a SoilTemp ([website](https://soiltemp.weebly.com/)) call. One of the sensors doesn't work so I did preliminary tests with 9. These sensors are set to sample every 15 min and measures 3 temperatures (soil, ground and 10cm above the ground) and soil moisture: 

![](./Images/tms4_measure.png){width=20%}



The idea was to place the sensors in the Botanical Gardens of Cartagena but the day I planned to go, there were road blockages from the national strike. So, I ended up placing them sensors in the gardens of the building I live in. I chose 5 treatments:

# Data exploration


<!-- Using R software is a great way to visualize the temperature and soil moisture data by years, months and days.  -->
Here are some figures from the prelimi the difference in measurements between dataloggers and the difference between temperature 1, 2 and 3 (*i.e.*, soil, ground and aboveground).

```{r,include=FALSE}
files <- list.files("./data",pattern = "data.*_1",full.names = T)
basename(files)
basen<-substr(basename(files),6,13)
listdata<-lapply(files,read.csv2,h=F)
str(data.frame(listdata[[1]],sensor=basen[1]))
for(i in 1:length(listdata)) listdata[[i]]<-data.frame(listdata[[i]],sensor=basen[i])
datum<-do.call(rbind,listdata)
colnames(datum)<-c("ID","Date","TimeZone","Temp1","Temp2","Temp3","SoilMoisture","Shake","ErrorFlag","Unknown","Sensor")
str(datum)
datum$ID<-as.integer(factor(datum$Date))
length(unique(datum$ID))

### Comparar temp1,2 y 3 del mismo datalogger----
condi<-datum$ID%in%(46325:47500)
unique(datum$Date[condi])
rango<-range(datum[condi,c("Temp1","Temp2","Temp3")])

table(substr(datum$Date[datum$ID%in%(62+0:1000*96)],12,16))
table(substr(datum$Date[datum$ID%in%(14+0:1000*96)],12,16))

idtreat <- data.frame(sensorid=c(94202093,94202100,94202096,94202098,94202094,94202095,94202092,94202099,94202091),treat=c('Grass','Grass','Wall','Wall','Palm','Palm','Bushes','Bushes','Air-not buried'))
```

## Each sensor

## {.tabset}
```{r results='asis', echo=FALSE} 
for(i in idtreat$sensorid) {
  cat('###',i,'-', idtreat$treat[idtreat$sensorid==i],' \n')
  with(datum[condi&datum$Sensor==i,],plot(1,col=NA,ylim=rango,xlim=range(ID),main=i,xlab="ID",ylab="Temperature"))
  with(datum[condi&datum$Sensor==i,],lines(ID,Temp1,col="blue"))
  with(datum[condi&datum$Sensor==i,],lines(ID,Temp2,col="green"))
  with(datum[condi&datum$Sensor==i,],lines(ID,Temp3,col="red"))
  legend("topright",legend=c("Soil","Mid","Top"),col=c("blue","green","red"),lty=1,bty="n")
  abline(v=62+0:1000*96,col="grey",lty=1)
  abline(v=14+0:1000*96,col="darkgoldenrod",lty=2)
  cat(' \n \n')
}

```

## Measurements between treatments {.tabset}

### Soil temperature

```{r,echo=FALSE}
plot(datum[condi,c("ID","Temp1")],col=NA,xlim=c(46325,47500),ylab="Soil temperature", ylim=rango)
for(i in 1:length(unique(datum$Sensor))) with(datum[condi & datum$Sensor==unique(datum$Sensor)[i],],lines(ID,Temp1,type="l",col=c("red","darkgoldenrod4","forestgreen","dodgerblue","dodgerblue","darkorchid","darkorchid","darkgoldenrod4","forestgreen")[i]))
abline(v=62+0:1000*96,col="grey",lty=1)
abline(v=14+0:1000*96,col="darkgoldenrod",lty=2)
legend("topright",legend=c("Grass","Palm under.","Air","Bushes","Wall"),col=c("forestgreen","dodgerblue","red","darkgoldenrod4","darkorchid"),lty=1,bty="n",cex=0.7)

```
